channel.title: Yum Yum at TechNative
channel.description: Recent content on Yum Yum at TechNative

item.title: About
item.description: Hey there! This is an open source recipe website. Setup Some fun facts about the setup of this project include: Built with Quiqr and Hugo Hosted for free on GitHub Pages Developed using Vim, while listening to a variety of great tracks Have questions or suggestions? Feel free to open an issue on GitHub. Cheers üçí

item.title: French Sourdough Bread v1.0
item.description: I make this bread every day. It doesn’t take much of my time. About 10 minutes in the evening and 3 minutes in the morning. Before going to bed, I prepare the dough. First, I put water in the bread pan. Then the sourdough starter, followed by the flour, and finally the salt. The quantities may vary. Sometimes, while the bread machine is kneading, I add a bit more water or flour as needed.

item.title: Indian vegan Curry with Naan v1.0
item.description: 1 Was de komkommer, halveer in de lengte en verwijder de zaadlijsten met een theelepel. Snijd het vruchtvlees in blokjes. Snipper de ui. Spoel de kikkererwten af onder koud stromend water en laat uitlekken. 2 Verhit de olie in een hapjespan en fruit de uien 2 min. op middelhoog vuur. Voeg de currypasta toe en fruit 2 min. mee. Voeg de kikkererwten, tomatenblokjes, komkommer en kokosmelk toe, breng aan de kook en kook het geheel in ca.

item.title: Mulligatawny soup
item.description: A delicious comfort soup with a lot of veggies, herbs, and spices. Preparation: Heat 2 tablespoons of ghee in a soup pot. Saut√© the chopped onions and garlic. Finely chop the dried chili peppers. Add them to the pot along with the cumin seeds, crushed coriander seeds, mustard seeds, turmeric, and madras curry powder. Saut√© for a moment. Add the cinnamon stick and grated fresh ginger. Saut√© briefly. Rinse the lentils.

item.title: Naan bread
item.description: This recipe is for plain naans, but don’t let that stop you from adding garlic butter! Preparation: Place the flour in a large mixing bowl. Make a well in the center and add 2 tablespoons of oil, yogurt, yeast, sugar, salt, and baking powder. Mix everything with your fingertips until the mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs. Gradually add the warm milk, mixing everything together until it forms a cohesive dough. Transfer the dough onto a clean, floured work surface.

item.title: Roasted marinated tofu with broccoli
item.description: An easy and delicious meal! Preparation: Drain the tofu, wrap it in kitchen paper, and place something heavy on top to press out the moisture. Let it sit for at least 30 minutes. Mix the dark soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, brown sugar, ginger root, sriracha, sesame oil and garlic together in a large bowl. Remove the kitchen paper and cut the tofu into eight equal slices. Place them in the marinade and let them marinate for at least 30 minutes.

item.title: Savoury tart with spinach and ham and tomato
item.description: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees. Remove the puff pastry sheets from the freezer and let them come to room temperature. Meanwhile, cut the bell pepper into cubes and finely chop the garlic. Pour a very small dash of oil into a frying pan and let the spinach wilt over a low heat. Once it has shrunk squeeze out the liquid from the spinach using, for example, a sieve.

item.title: Tomato stew with lentils and olives
item.description: A hearty one-pot dish packed with flavor. Preparation: Finely chop the onion and garlic. Heat oil in a pan and saut√© the onion for about 5 minutes over medium heat. Add the garlic and saut√© briefly. Dice the sweet potatoes and add them to the pan along with the spices and salt. Saut√© them well. Rinse the red lentils and add them to the pan along with the diced tomatoes and tomato paste.
